title: I Can’t Sleep Without These 10 Items and They’re Still on Sale for Cyber Week
description: We're nearly at the end of Cyber Week but the best deals on sleep items haven't all stopped. These products, tested by our sleep experts, will make great gifts.
author: Caroline Igo
excerpt: We're nearly at the end of Cyber Week but the best deals on sleep items haven't all stopped. These products, tested by our sleep experts, will make great gifts.
text: Sleep is an essential part of our routines. Not only do you need enough sleep every night, but you also need quality sleep. The quality of your sleep affects almost every aspect of your life. Waking up feeling tired and groggy isn’t the best way to tackle a busy day. If you’ve been struggling with sleep, sleep accessories like cozy bedding, plush mattresses, noise-blocking earplugs and more can make a huge difference in your quality of sleep. Catch these lingering Cyber Week deals and give the gift of sleep this holiday season. This time of year can be stressful, with long to-do lists and extra activities. These tools for better sleep will be much appreciated. Luckily, thanks to many Cyber Week sales, there's still a good variety of sleep products to purchase. At CNET, we've been testing sleep products and mattresses for years, finding the best sleep products for your needs. With that knowledge, I put together this guide to my favorite sleep tech and sleep accessories still on sale right now.Cyber Week ends tomorrow, though, so these deals are almost out the door. Amazon/CNETBest Cyber Week sleep deals this holiday season Nasha Addarich Martinez/CNET Hatch’s popular and widely loved Restore 2 smart sleep clock mimics the rise of the sun to naturally wake you up in the mornings. Rated CNET’s top sunrise alarm clock, Hatch Restore 2 also plays sounds to help you fall asleep at night. Hatch hardly ever has deals, so take advantage of $45 off the Restore 2 clock and $5 off Rest clock models with free coverlets right now. Aly Lopez/CNET Hot sleepers know the struggle of waking up covered in sweat. The Eight Sleep Pod Cover has been essential for my sleep and has helped keep me cool. The Pod warms or cools you during the night based on your preferences and automatically adjusts your temperature to mimic your sleep cycle through the night. In addition, it also tracks your sleep, heart rate, heart rate variability, breath rate and snoring. I sleep on the Pod 3 Cover every night, and while that isn’t currently on sale, the Pod 4 model is up to $250 off. The Pod 4 Ultra model includes an adjustable base and is up to $400 off. Act fast if you want to snag this deal, as it ends soon. Sleepme Caroline Igo/CNET Lucid/Amazon Update your mattress or an old bed by adding a mattress topper. Lucid offers two popular gel memory foam toppers and one topper bundle. During its Cyber Week sale save up to 20% off the Gel Memory Foam Topper. Dillon Lopez/CNET I use a Garmin watch to track both my sleep and my runs. Runners and sleep lovers on your list are bound to appreciate a watch that does both. Garmin’s holiday sale includes savings on its smartwatches with sleep-tracking features such as the Vivoactive 5, the Lily 2, the Forerunner 255 and the Forerunner 955. Cozy Earth Cozy Earth makes some of the softest bedding I have ever tested, and the same can be said for its pajamas. Created with Cozy Earth’s signature materials (bamboo viscose, cotton and silk), its pajamas feel luxurious and high-quality. During its extended Cyber Monday sale, you can get discounts on men's and women's pajamas as well as bedding and more. The popular Women’s Long Sleeve Bamboo Pajama Set is down to $117 (originally $195) and the Men’s Stretch-Knit Bamboo Lounge Tee is $54 (originally $90). A queen-sized Bamboo Sheet set is down to $233 (originally $389). Tea Forte Some sleep lovers, like myself, love to settle down for bed with a hot cup of herbal tea. Tea Forte makes my favorite tea assortments, and a box of up to 40 tea infusers is a perfect gift. Save 30% sitewide and 35% on all gift bundles during the extended Cyber Monday event. I recommend the Herbal Retreat Presentation assortment (now only $24); it comes with 20 pyramid tea infusers. Ozlo Drown out noise and background sounds (such as snoring from your partner) with a pair of sleep headphones. Ozlo Sleep makes some of our favorite comfortable sleepbuds. During Ozolo Sleep's holiday sale, save $15 off one pair of sleepbuds and $60 off two pairs. It should auto-apply but if it doesn't, use should try using code BF24 for one pair and code 2BF24 for two pairs at checkout. Slip Slip offers high-quality silky sleep products from sleep masks to pillowcases to hair accessories. During its Black Friday/Cyber Monday sale, Slip offered up to 60% off select items and up to 30% off almost everything else. This brought its popular Rose Contour Sleep Mask down to $39 (originally $55) and the Queen Zippered Pillowcase to as low as $36 (originally $89).Currently, Slip is no longer offering any Black Friday or Cyber Monday deals, but be sure to check back in the future when other sales come around. Looking for the last of the lingering Cyber Week deals? We've found plenty you can still shop at Amazon as well as Walmart and Best Buy. If you're in the gift-buying mood, be sure to read our ultimate gift roundup.
